bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to Alvey A. Adee, January 3, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General
U.S. Second Assistant Secretary of State

div1.p: No. 49
DEPARTMENT OF STATE FEB 8 1890 RECEIVED.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 3rd, 1890
Mer. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Subject:
Last WIll and Testament of Mers. Alice Fuller
No 49
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 3rd, 1890
Honorable Alvey A. Adee, Second Assistant Secretary, Washington, D.C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of your No. 9. Despatch of November 16th 1889, instructing me to procure a copy of the "Last Will and Testament" of Alice Fuller, who died in this city in the month of June 1888.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General
Enclosures One. Copy of the Last Will and Testament of Mers Fuller.

In the name of God Amen I Alice Fuller of the City of Monrovia County of Mentserrad, and the Republic of Liberia being of Sound disposing mind but feeble in body do make public and declare this to be my Last Will and Testament in Mannes fallowing.

1st After all my just debts and funneral expenses are paid, I give and leave my half lot on Broad Street in the city of Monrovia to Clara Fuller Weaver wife of Kincoln Napolion Weaver. to her and her heirs forever, free from all control or disposal of her husband. to have and to hold the same to her and her heirs forever.

2nd I give and devise to Mrs Sarah J Woods wife of Tyson Woods of Cape Palmas, one of my Town Lots located if one collection in the town of Greenville Senoe County to have and to hold to her and her heirs forever ____ and I give an devise the other two lots located in said Greenville, one to my dear friend Emma A. Cooper and the other to my dear friend Sarah C. Yates to have and to hold the said prperty to each in Severalty to them and their heris

3rd I give and bequeath to Benjamin V. R. Melville, all my and Tethle to the house in Front Street in Monrovia that yours now having built and I also give and bequeath to him two hundred dollars in order to help him to finish siad house-- (over).

4th I have Several orders coming out from America and England and when they come and are disposed of I give and bequeath an equal share of the proceeds to the Saia B. V. R. Melville Arna U. Fuller his mother, my friend Sarah C. Yates, and my friend Marla Q Pervell's and a Rationof said proceeds I wish to go to my friend Mrs Braxton Bath fifty six dollars of the money in these orders belong to Anna W. Fuller and the above devision of proceeds cannot be made until after her said money are deducted out of the proceeds.

5th I give and bequeath all my new goods now in the house where I am living to my friends Anna W. Fuller, B. R. Melville, Mara Q Povell Sarah C. Yates and Mrs Braxton to be divided in equal shares to all except Mrs Braxton who is to have a lesser share than the others.
6th I give and bequeath to my dear friend Emma A Cooper my Large Shin casenow in her posession, and anything else of mine that she may want; and also my Seales.
7th I give and bequeath to my friend Y. C. Dickens my small seales now in his possession

8th I have (eighteen hundred dollars) $1800 now in the East Brooklyn Saving Bank which I wish the moneis there on interest for two years after my death, at which time I want it divided and I give and bequeath (over)

out of said money (Five hundred dollars) to my afflicted Sister Mary Daylan residing in Charleston South Carolina, and I request Messers Yates and Porter feild of 59 South SA New York who now have my Deposet Book in their presence to find out my said sister and pay over said money to her in person or to her representation, and to my nephews Robert Cand, John B. Daylan of the City of Washington D.C. M.S. A. I give and bequeath two hundred dollars ash out of said money to be paid to them by Messers Yates & Porter field, and I give an bequeath to Mary M. Denglass wife of Robert I. Darylass my brother one hundred dollars $100 out of said money, and mt of the remainder of said money I give and bequeath to my friend Maria Z Rowell one hundred dollars and to my friend Sarah C. Yates one hundred dollars and to my friend Emma A Cooper One hundred dollars and to my friend Anna W Fuller one hundred dollars and alos one hundred dollars to my friend B. R. Mehills also fifty dollars to my dear friend Mrs Ninmms- also I give to Joseph M. Gibson Fifty Dollars also to Mary Euphemia daughters of W M & E. S. Davis Fifty dollars to Mary McIntosh daughter of Anna V. Houston I give Fifty dollars and to Louisa Leone daughter of the lat Louis R Leone I give Fifty dollars also I give fifty dollars to my friend Thomas W Howard (over)

I give and bequeath the above Several Sums of money to the Several persons above named in the order named the above erasure and after Alive over made before this was signed Y name Wm M. Davis and Bey V. R. Mellville to be Executives of this my last will and Testament.
Monrovia June 14th 1888 (Signed) Alice Fuller
Signed Sealed and delivered in presence of us and declared by the said Alice Fuller to be her last will and Testament in presence of us who at our names as witnesses
Emma A Cooper Sarah C. Yates
copy from the original the 2nd day of Jany 1890 N. L. Perkins
